page.title: 12RACE COURSE ESTATE NORTHOLT
page.content: {The Race Course Estate}lies to the North of Mandeville Road Northolt, on the high ground above the Clock Tower. From the Estate one can look out over London and{St. Mary's Church. }The development has taken 30 years and building is still in progress. There is a mixture of housing from detached houses to blocks of flats. As the name implies the Estate is built on the site of the old{Northolt Race {Course.} Northolt Race Course was one of a number of{Pony Turf Club administered Race Courses, operating between the First and Second World Wars. The equivalent of 'The Derby' but for ponies was run on this course. Race meetings took place several times a week and in the evenings.
